metadata.title: bind: stack exhaustion in control channel code may lead to DoS (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in the Bind package. The code that processes control channel messages sent to named calls certain functions recursively during packet parsing. Recursion depth is only limited by the maximum accepted packet size. Depending on the environment, this may cause the packet-parsing code to run out of available stack memory, causing named to terminate unexpectedly. 
            STATEMENT: Since each incoming control channel message is fully parsed before its contents are authenticated, exploiting this flaw does not require the attacker to hold a valid RNDC key, only network access to the control channel’s configured TCP port is necessary.
            MITIGATION: By default, named only allows control-channel connections over the loopback interface, making this attack impossible to carry out over the network. When enabling remote access to the control channel’s configured TCP port, care should be taken to limit such access to trusted IP ranges on the network level, effectively preventing unauthorized parties from carrying out the attack described in this advisory.

criterions.comment: bind-sdb is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
bind-libs is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
bind is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
bind-utils is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
bind-chroot is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
bind-devel is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
